fix: Bot naming finds next available number after kicks

Fixed bug where "Add Bot" button stopped working after kicking bots.

Root Cause:
Old logic counted existing bots and added 1 to create name:
- If you have Bot 2 and Bot 3 (after kicking Bot 1)
- existingBots.length = 2
- New bot name: "Bot 3" ‚ùå (already exists!)
- Backend treats it as rejoin attempt instead of new bot

Example Failure Scenario:
1. Start with Bot 1, Bot 2, Bot 3
2. Kick Bot 1 (or replace with human)
3. Now have: Bot 2, Bot 3, You
4. Click "Add Bot"
5. Tries to create "Bot 3" (count=2, so 2+1=3)
6. Backend sees existing "Bot 3" ‚Üí rejoin logic
7. Nothing happens! üêõ

New Logic:
- Extract existing bot numbers: [2, 3]
- Find smallest available number 1-3: finds 1 ‚úÖ
- Creates "Bot 1" (new unique name)
- Backend adds new bot successfully

Changes:
- frontend/src/App.tsx: handleAddBot now finds next available number
- Matches backend's getNextBotName() pattern (already correct)
- Supports bot numbers 1-3 (max 3 bots per game)

Result: "Add Bot" works correctly even after kicking bots or
replacing them with human players.
